body_html:
Hi, I just want to test out some of the sparse function, so I tried to run the example @killeent provide.

x = torch.sparse.FloatTensor(5, 5)
y = torch.FloatTensor(5, 5)

torch.mm(x, y) # works

xx = torch.autograd.Variable(x)
xy = torch.autograd.Variable(y)
print(type(x), type(xx))

torch.mm(xx, xy) # I think here we want to check if backward things

And I got the following error message:
RuntimeError: Expected object of type Variable[Sparsetorch.FloatTensor] but found type Variable[torch.FloatTensor] for argument #1 'mat2'

it seems like some relevant functions are added, however, expect the second argument as sparse as well??
(my version is 0.2.0+5de7f9e)
Not sure if I did something wrong about it.
Thx in advance for this!

body:
Hi, I just want to test out some of the sparse function, so I tried to run the example @killeent provide.
```
x = torch.sparse.FloatTensor(5, 5)
y = torch.FloatTensor(5, 5)

torch.mm(x, y) # works

xx = torch.autograd.Variable(x)
xy = torch.autograd.Variable(y)
print(type(x), type(xx))

torch.mm(xx, xy) # I think here we want to check if backward things  
```

And I got the following error message:
` RuntimeError: Expected object of type Variable[Sparsetorch.FloatTensor] but found type Variable[torch.FloatTensor] for argument #1 'mat2' `

it seems like some relevant functions are added, however, expect the second argument as sparse as well??
(my version is 0.2.0+5de7f9e)
Not sure if I did something wrong about it.
Thx in advance for this!
